intro: Caprifolium dumetorum, commonly known as devil's weed or common hemp-nettle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in woodland areas. Caprifolium dumetorum is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
